intro: Ornithogalum paucifolium, commonly known as the few-leaved star-of-Bethleem, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features a short, underground rhizome with a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the summer months. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
